channel.title: Featured on My New Hugo Site
channel.description: Recent content in Featured on My New Hugo Site

item.title: Everything We Know About 'Saand Ki Aankh' Starring Taapsee & Bhumi
item.description: Anurag Kashyap is back with yet another offbeat film called Saand Ki Aankh starring Taapsee Pannu and Bhumi Pednekar. These badass women are going to play two real-life badass 60-somethings who happen to be sharpshooters.

item.title: 5 Reasons Why You Must Follow Sushmita Sen on Instagram
item.description: Sushmita Sen keeps it real and relatable. Scrolling through her anecdotes, fitness videos and posts about her daughters, all we feel is positivity!

item.title: Celebrities who spoke about their anxiety and depression
item.description: It takes a lot to open up about it, that too on a public platform. But these heroes stepped up just for the sake of normalising these issues so that people can take heed and understand it.

item.title: Top 5 Ranbir Kapoor Movies of All Time
item.description: Ranbir Kapoor has time and again proven his acting proficiency and given us a number of blockbuster hits in the last 10 years of his shining career. We list a few that won our hearts!

item.title: Apt Bollywood Songs for Top GoT Scenes
item.description: The heady mix of dragons and nudity does work wonders for TRP. But what connects it to our old school Bollywood is perhaps the element of drama.

item.title: Spotlight: Rajkummar Rao
item.description: Rajkummar Rao is a chameleon. He can be an introvert as Govind in Kai Po Che and a flamboyant Pritam in Bareilly Ki Barfi. There ain’t no role this perfectionist can’t pull off.

item.title: Top 3 Unconventional Leading Actors Of Bollywood Today
item.description: These Unconventional actors have successfully proved that it’s not all about the songs, the dance or the good looks; but - the art of acting and entertainment.

item.title: Spotlight: Taapsee Pannu
item.description: The loud-heart, the feisty and the ever-empowered Taapsee Pannu has won our hearts with her fierce roles and fearless persona.

item.title: Spotlight: Kangana Ranaut
item.description: Call her Queen, Datto, Simran or Manikarnika, the feisty and daring Kangana Ranaut has created her own glorious niche in Bollywood.

item.title: Spotlight: Kalki Koechlin
item.description: Kalki has time and again proven to be the epitome of experimentation. Her characters can whisper as softly and bawl as loudly.

item.title: We Choose Sara Ali Khan Over Janhvi Kapoor. Here’s Why.
item.description: Although there is nothing beyond healthy competition between the two, we couldn’t help but pit them against each other on the basis of their debut films.

item.title: An Ode to Retro Star Shammi Kapoor
item.description: Shammi Kapoor’s movies had the most foot-tapping music and his iconic Elvis Presley inspired hair plus dance moves took the 60s party vibe to an all new level. He basically taught India how to party back in the day!

item.title: Top 3 Character artists in Bollywood
item.description: Call them subordinates, sidekicks or supporting actors, movies are incomplete without their dynamic acts and we’re here to give their journey a big shoutout.
